verses.verse: (For the choir director; on stringed instruments. A Psalm of David.) Answer <WH6030> me when I call, <WH7121> O God <WH430> of my righteousness! <WH6664> Thou hast relieved <WH7337> me in my distress; <WH9496> Be gracious <WH2603> to me and hear <WH8085> my prayer. <WH8605>

O sons <WH1121> of men, <WH376> how <WH4100> long <WH5704> will my honor <WH9202> become a reproach <WH3639>? [How long] will you love <WH157> what <WH7385> is worthless <WH7385> and aim <WH1245> at deception <WH3577>? Selah. <WH5542>
But know <WH3045> that the Lord <WH3068> has set <WH6395> apart <WH6395> the godly <WH2623> man <WH2623> for Himself; The Lord <WH3068> hears <WH8085> when I call <WH7121> to Him.
Tremble, <WH7264> and do not sin; <WH2398> Meditate <WH559> in your heart <WH3824> upon your bed, <WH4904> and be still. <WH1826> Selah. <WH5542>
Offer <WH2076> the sacrifices <WH2077> of righteousness, <WH6664> And trust <WH982> in the Lord. <WH3068>
Many <WH7227> are saying, <WH559> "Who <WH4310> will show <WH7200> us [any] good <WH9185>?" Lift <WH5375> up the light <WH216> of Thy countenance <WH6440> upon us, O Lord! <WH3068>
Thou hast put <WH5414> gladness <WH8057> in my heart, <WH3820> More <WH4480> than <WH4480> when <WH6256> their grain <WH1715> and new <WH8492> wine <WH8492> abound. <WH7231>
In peace <WH7965> I will both <WH3162> lie <WH7901> down <WH7901> and sleep, <WH3462> For Thou alone, <WH910> O Lord, <WH3068> dost make me to dwell <WH3427> in safety. <WH983>
